snippet: Regulators in Washington and Tokyo said they had no answers to explain why two batteries on Boeing’s troubled Dreamliner emitted fire or smoke.
abstract: Regulators in Washington and Tokyo say they have not found enough evidence in the charred remains of two Boeing 787 batteries to determine why they overheated, and will expand their examination of other electrical components in their investigation.

byline.original: By JAD MOUAWAD and CHRISTOPHER DREW
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Regulators in Washington and Tokyo said they had no answers to explain why two batteries on Boeing’s troubled Dreamliner emitted fire or smoke.

headline.seo: Inquiry Into 787 Batteries Expands to Other Components
headline.main: Investigators Begin to Test Other Electrical Parts on the 787
headline.print_headline: Investigators Begin to Test Other Parts On the 787
